There are Plenty of such old beautiful gems…. I am going to share some of my favorite songs by parting them with the list of the my favorite two singers… So, enjoy!!! :) Lata “Cuckoo” MangeshkarShe indeed born on this world but her voice came from the heavens. The richness of her soothing voice and her tonal quality has no comparison to any other female voice in this world. Yes, other beautiful voiced singers like Suman Kalyanpur, Alka Yagnik, Kavita Krishnamurty have done very good job, but being Lata, that’s IMPOSSIBLE. Here are some of her rarest gems. I am sure you would love each and every masterpiece. :) 1. Sawre Sawre Kaahe Mose Kare Jora Jori - Anuradha (1960)  2. Suno Sajna Papihe Ne - Aaye Din Bahaar Ke (1966)  3. Jaa Re Badra Bairi Jaa - Bahaana (1960)  4. Baaju-Bandh Khul Khul Jaaye - Non-Filmi (Raag Bhairvi)  His Highness Mohd. RafisahabThis personality doesn’t need any intro to describe his apex level singing talent. The legends like Rafisahab incarnates once in entire era. The owns the honor of an ‘Alto’. Alto stands for a man with highest natural voice. His vocal range is just as same as his character : Extremely High. Enjoy some of his Alto songs. :) 1. O Duniya Ke Rakhwale - Baiju Bawra (1952)  2. Mann Tarapat Hari Darshan Ko Aaj - Baiju Bawra (1952)  3. Ek Haseen Shaam Ko Dil Mera Kho Gayaa - Dulhan Ek Raat Ki (1966)  4. Jaane Bahaar Husn Tera Bemisaal Hai - Pyar Kiya To Darna Kya
